questions.question:
Answer the questions given below (refer Fig.1):


Fig. 1 Circuit diagram of three-phase bridge inverter


1. What are the full forms of CSI and VSI?

answers.a: Constant source Inverter and Variable Source Inverter
answers.b: Constant Source Inverter and Voltage Source Inverter
answers.c: Current Source Inverter and Variable Source Inverter
answers.d: Current Source Inverter and Voltage Source Inverter

explanations.d: Explanation 4: CSI: Current Source Inverter, VSI: Voltage Source Inverter

questions.question: 2. How many switches in three phase inverter are in “ON” state simultaneously?

explanations.b:
Explanation 2: At any given time, three switches are ON:
• One from the upper group (S1, S3, S5).
• Two from the lower group (S2, S4, S6), or vice versa.

questions.question: 3. Which of the carrier signal is more suitable for sinusoidal pulse width modulation:

explanations.b: Explanation 2: The triangular carrier signal is compared with the sinusoidal reference signal to generate the PWM signals.

questions.question: 4. In sinusoidal pulse width modulation, the comparator output is high when the

answers.a: triangular wave has magnitude higher than the sinusoidal wave
answers.b: sinusoidal wave has magnitude higher than triangular wave
answers.c: triangular wave has magnitude equal to the sinusoidal wave

explanations.b:
Explanation 2: In Sinusoidal Pulse Width Modulation (SPWM), the comparator output is HIGH when:
Vreference > Vcarrier

questions.question: 5. In three-phase inverter shown in Fig.1, which of the following switches should NOT be turned ON simultaneously?

explanations.d: Explanation 4: If S<sub>1</sub> and S<sub>4</sub> are turned ON simultaneously, they will short the input DC supply.
